intro: Lunathyrium liangshanense, commonly known as the Liangshan bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Sichuan, China. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to violet flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments and has lance-shaped leaves with a rough texture. It is a perennial herb that thrives in cool climates and is often found in forested areas. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species within its native habitat.
